definition: to cook on a skewer/barbecued food on a skewer/shish kebab/(fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence/sequence of songs/medley

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: The vegetable skewer's saving grace is the Yakitori sauce.
sentences.chinese: 日式串烧的酱料可说是蔬菜串烧的救星。

sentences.english: The vegetable skewer's saving grace is the Yakitori sauce.
sentences.chinese: 日式串烧的酱料可说是蔬菜串烧的救星。

sentences.english: Pan - fry kebabs in 2 tbsp oil until golden yellow and done . set aside.
sentences.chinese: 用2汤匙油将串烧煎至金黄熟透，取起待用。

sentences.english: You can put the baking stuff on the chain conveyer.
sentences.chinese: 采用链条式轮送，串烧可直接放置在链条上输送烘烤。

sentences.english: Compared to Kobe beef, skewers and other snacks, it is more mysterious.
sentences.chinese: 比起神户牛，串烧等小吃，它更有神秘感。

sentences.english: The appetizing kabob and steak cooked on the spot will match various tastes.
sentences.chinese: 现场的烧烤供应各款进口扒类和串烧，香气四溢。

definition: sung performance/to sing for an audience
